result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Goodrum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Restitution set at $573.00, payable to Tiffany L. Court ordered restitution as to JusticePoint Program held open.

- Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees.
Consecutive to: consecutive to case #14CF3272, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with Michael Dandridge, Tiffany L., and the Speedway Gas Station located at 302 N. 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.

- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for WSAP eligibility.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing JULY 1, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Offer placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by state, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to case #14CF3272, with credit for 0 days time served.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Restitution set at $573.00, payable to Tiffany L.  Court ordered restitution as to JusticePoint Program held open.
- Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.
- Pay all supervision fees .
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with Michael Dandridge, Tiffany L., and the Speedway Gas Station located at 302 N. 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.  Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case set for Sentencing hearing. Defense request an adjournment.  Court grants one last adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Contact made with the Public Defenders office.  Public Defenders office made attempt to contact previous counsel, Thomas Kasen.  Attorney Kasen has not contacted the Public Defenders office to accept appointment.  Matter adjourned to May 6, 2016.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on April 28, 2016; Bench warrant in file.  Public Defender's Office notified of the necessity for new appointment of counsel.  Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant in Br. 19.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary, received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($5000.00 signature bond) gj
REMAND TO THE COURT

Attorney Thomas j Kasen in court.  Thomas Potter for Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was informed by City of Milwaukee Police Detective that defendant has cut off his GPS monitoring device.  Defendant fails to appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant be issued, REMAND to the COURT, and ordered the signature bond forfeited.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Violation report, failure to charge GPS device, received and filed
Oral No Contact Order with co-actor or victim.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armour.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court orders transcript from today's hearing be sealed.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas j Kasen in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case mis-calendared for today's date.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19 to follow case 14CF3272.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Kasen appears as new counsel for the defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for Deann Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Attorney Guerin motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Attorney Guerin to notify the public defender's office.  Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Defendant to be produced.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant William D Goodrum not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody. Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Brian Stott. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case reassigned to Judge Witkowiak in Branch 22 due to lower pending case. Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  State's witnesses not available for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TIFFANY L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William D Goodrum in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant William D Goodrum in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
